Express Revocation of Representation by the Represented Individual
A represented individual (generally, a claimant or beneficiary, guardian, or fiduciary) may end the relationship with their appointed representative at any time by expressly (explicitly, clearly) telling VA.  This is known as
express revocation
of the representative’s appointment.
Examples
:
“I don’t want American Legion to be my representative anymore.”
“Please remove Disabled American Veterans as my representative immediately.”
Important
:  The act of a represented individual submitting paperwork to appoint a new representative is not express revocation.  However, this may be sufficient to implicitly revoke an appointment.
When a claimant expressly revokes representation, take the actions specified in
M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, 2.C.1.f
.
References
:  For more information on
processing requests to revoke a representative, to include notifying a revoked representative, see
M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, 2.C.1.f
required system updates for changes in POA appointments, see
M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, 2.C.2
the guidelines for changing representation after certification and transfer of an appeal, see
M21-5, Chapter 7, Section F, 5.e
, and
implicit revocation of representation by appointment of a new representative, see
M21-1, Part I, Subpart i, 2.A.6.c
.
